cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, then forecast to turn northeast and accelerate parallel to the Southeast U.S. coast, passing near the Outer Banks before curving out into the western Atlantic toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Rip-current and surf impacts expected from northeast Florida through the Carolinas; direct tropical-storm impacts focused on the North Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional coastal gusts 25–35 mph possible Sunday afternoon into early Monday; sustained tropical-storm force winds not expected at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises up to 1 ft possible along northeast Florida beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent showers, generally less than 1–2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents that could disrupt vessel small-craft operations near the harbor entrance
